descript.abstract: Layer identifies the location of public (state owned) and private (church owned) cemeteries throughout St Vincent and the Grenadines. Family cemeteries are not included in this layer.
descript.purpose: Developed to locate and visualize cemetaries in St. Vincent and the Grenadines. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project and the impact to culturally important areas like cemetaries to communities during inundation events for St Vincent and the Grenadines. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.
